txt.en: I collected a summoning horn that washed up on the shore to alert my friend that I was alive. Fate, it seemed saw fit to spare us both....
At last, Yarikh came into view. Two of his lieutenants flanked him near a serviceable launch they were trying to get into the sea. We wasted no time to engage.
I looked my friend over and asked if they could continue....
We scoured the beach, slaughtering with impunity. None could withstand our vengeance or our blades....
Yarikh's boat slipped out of sight as my blade wet itself on Akhât's corpse. Behind me, I heard a gasp and sputter for air... my friend.
Make your way to your friend's side

'Do not worry after me...

'I would have followed you to the end of the world. My friend... my-'

The last word is cut short as the man perishes on the sand.
With a new ship, the vengeful captain set out in search of Yarikh....

'Aye, I am able, though not hardy. Let us not let my injury allow them to escape again.'

He groans.

'Press onward.'
